intro: Begonia subperfoliata, commonly known as the leafy begonia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves that often have a deep green color with a slight sheen. The plant produces clusters of small, bright red flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Begonia subperfoliata is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
